name: South Korea
info:
Capital - Seoul. 
Since the 21st century, this wonderful country has been renowned for its globally influential pop culture, particularly in music (K-pop), TV dramas (K-dramas) and cinema.

name: Morocco
info:
Capital - Rabat.
Mint tea is the national drink of Morocco.
This country is known for its Medinas, which are cities' historical downtowns and the place to hunt for traditional handicrafts.

name: Norway
info:
Capital - Oslo.
Norway is known as the land of the Midnight Sun.
It's famous for its phenomenal fjords, lakes and magical skies.

name: Canada
info:
Capital - Ottawa.
Canada has less gravity than anywhere else in the world.

name: Poland
info:
Capital - Warsaw.
Poland is known for being the home of delicious pierogi, former pope John Paul II, and Europe's most ancient old-growth forest.

name: USA
info:
Captial - Washington, D.C..
National language - English.
The United States is the only country that has all of Earth's five climate zones: tropical, dry, temperate, continental, and polar.

name: UAE
info:
Capital - Abu Dhabi.
Official language - Arabic.
The UAE has a Minister for Happiness.
The Palm Jumeirah can be seen from space.

name: France
info:
Capital - Paris.
France is smaller than Texas.
France produces over 1,500 types of cheese.
This country has the highest number of Nobel Prize winners in literature in the world.

name: Spain
info:
Capital - Madrid.
Like most languages, Spanish has its own very unique words which can not be translated in other languages.
Beautiful, scenic, and incredibly relaxing, the Spanish beaches are one of the many reasons why so many people choose Spain as their beloved destination.

name: Japan
info:
Capital - Tokyo.
Manga and anime are perhaps Japan's biggest cultural export - and they make up one of the most recognizable art styles on the planet.
The Japanese flag is made up of a red circle, symbolizing the sun (it's known as the hinomaru in Japanese, means - circle of the sun).
